properties.Name: PsychographicCriteriaType

Columns.Name: PsychographicCriteriaTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Psychographic Criteria Type.

Columns.Name: PsychographicCriteriaTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of the Psychographic Criteria Type.

Columns.Name: PsychographicCriteriaTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of the Psychographic Criteria Type.

Properties.DerivedModelEntityInfo:
{"entityDirectives":{"baseEntityReference":{"name":"PsychographicCriteriaType","path":"PsychographicCriteriaType.cdm.json/PsychographicCriteriaType"},"description":"Psychographic Criteria Type is a means of classifying, grouping or categorizing specific Psychographic Criteria at a higher level for analysis and aggregation.

Demographics are the average or typical characteristics of the people who buy products or services. They include age, income, education, status or type of occupation, region of country and household size. Demographics can also include the age of children, home ownership, home value and urban or rural location. 

Psychographics take demographics further by addressing people's lifestyles and behaviors - their values, interests and what they do - their 'lifestyles'.
Psychographic Segmentation is market segmentation defined in terms of psychographics.   

This type of segmentation is frequently used because of the strong relationship between activities, interests and opinions and products or services purchased.    

Lifestyle groups are typically defined in terms of its member activities, interests and opinions.  Consumption patterns relate to when, why, where, and how consumers purchase or acquire goods or services.

The psychographic characteristics of a market influence the 'marketing mix' strategy components introduced to that market and sales channels used to provide products to that market.

The Psychographic Criteria is the specific criteria or value that will be linked to a Market Segment.   

The following are examples:

Psychographic Criteria:  Middle Class
Psychographic Criteria Type:  Social Class

Psychographic Criteria:  Young, Upwardly-mobile, Professional 
Psychographic Criteria Type: Lifestyle

Psychographic Criteria:  Conservative

Properties.Description:
Psychographic Criteria Type is a means of classifying, grouping or categorizing specific Psychographic Criteria at a higher level for analysis and aggregation.

Demographics are the average or typical characteristics of the people who buy products or services. They include age, income, education, status or type of occupation, region of country and household size. Demographics can also include the age of children, home ownership, home value and urban or rural location. 

Psychographics take demographics further by addressing people's lifestyles and behaviors - their values, interests and what they do - their 'lifestyles'.
Psychographic Segmentation is market segmentation defined in terms of psychographics.   

This type of segmentation is frequently used because of the strong relationship between activities, interests and opinions and products or services purchased.    

Lifestyle groups are typically defined in terms of its member activities, interests and opinions.  Consumption patterns relate to when, why, where, and how consumers purchase or acquire goods or services.

The psychographic characteristics of a market influence the 'marketing mix' strategy components introduced to that market and sales channels used to provide products to that market.

The Psychographic Criteria is the specific criteria or value that will be linked to a Market Segment.   

The following are examples:

Psychographic Criteria:  Middle Class
Psychographic Criteria Type:  Social Class

Psychographic Criteria:  Young, Upwardly-mobile, Professional 
Psychographic Criteria Type: Lifestyle

Psychographic Criteria:  Conservative
Psychographic Criteria Type:  Political Philosophy
